title: Structured Inquiry Design Workshop for Strengthening Problem-Based Learning (PBL) Competencies

context.prior_knowledge: Comprehension of core concepts and intermediate-level application skills
context.additional_context: Aims to strengthen non-degree adult learners' social problem-solving competencies in a smartphone-centric, limited-technology environment. Promotes learning transfer through real-life integrated tasks.

learning_goals: Learners can systematically solve community problems using a three-stage sequential inquiry process (Problem Definition → Analysis → Solution Development)
Learners can improve their inquiry process by documenting five or more iterative reflections in a digital portfolio
Learners can extract core factors of social issues by applying problem analysis frameworks (such as 5W1H) with 80% or higher accuracy

resources: Asynchronous Collaboration Tools for Minimizing Video Conferencing
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
